title: Bangladeshi Beef Rezala
content: This Mughlai-inspired delicacy from Dhaka features succulent beef slow-cooked in a yogurt-based gravy enriched with ghee, whole spices, and a touch of sweetness. Traditionally served at weddings, the rezala's white color comes from careful avoidance of turmeric. Serves 6-8.

Ingredients:
- 2 kg beef shank (bone-in)
- 2 cups Greek yogurt
- 1 cup fried onions
- 1/2 cup mustard oil
- 1 tbsp ginger paste
- 1 tbsp garlic paste
- 2 bay leaves
- 8 green cardamoms
- 1 mace blade
- 1 tsp shahi jeera
- 1/2 cup raw papaya paste (tenderizer)
- 1 tbsp rose water
- 1/2 cup milk
- 10 almonds (soaked & peeled)
- Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. Marinate beef with yogurt, papaya paste, ginger-garlic paste, and salt overnight.
2. Heat mustard oil until smoking point; cool slightly. Temper with bay leaves, cardamom, mace, and shahi jeera.
3. Add marinated beef; sear on high heat for 8 minutes.
4. Reduce heat, add fried onions, and cook covered for 90 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Blend soaked almonds with milk; add to curry along with rose water.
6. Simmer for 15 minutes until oil separates.

Tips:
• Use copper handi for authentic flavor
• Skim excess oil before serving
• Garnish with silver leaf for special occasions
• Pair with pulao or laccha paratha
• Replace beef with mutton for variation

title: Japanese Tonkotsu Ramen
content: Hakata-style ramen featuring creamy pork bone broth that's boiled for 12+ hours to extract maximum collagen, served with thin straight noodles and melt-in-your-mouth chashu pork. The ultimate comfort food from Fukuoka.

Ingredients:
Broth:
- 5 kg pork femurs
- 2 kg trotters
- 1 chicken carcass
- 1 onion (charred)
- 1 head garlic (roasted)

Toppings:
- 400g ramen noodles
- 6 slices chashu pork
- 2 soft-boiled eggs (marinated)
- 50g wood ear mushrooms
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 2 sheets nori
- 1 tbsp sesame seeds

Tare:
- 1/2 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup mirin
- 1 tbsp bonito flakes

Instructions:
1. Blanch pork bones for 15 minutes; scrub clean.
2. Boil bones with chicken carcass for 12 hours, skimming impurities.
3. Add charred onion and garlic last 2 hours.
4. Prepare chashu by rolling pork belly, tying, and braising for 3 hours.
5. Marinate eggs in soy-mirin mixture for 4 hours.
6. Assemble: 2 tbsp tare, 350ml broth, cooked noodles, arranged toppings.

Tips:
• Maintain rolling boil for milky broth
• Use alkaline noodles (kansui water)
• Slice chashu when cold
• Add black garlic oil for extra flavor
• Customize with spicy miso or shio tare

title: French Croissants
content: Master the art of laminated pastry with this detailed guide to creating perfect flaky croissants with honeycomb-structured interiors. Requires precise temperature control and European-style high-fat butter.

Ingredients:
Dough:
- 500g T55 flour
- 140ml cold milk
- 140ml cold water
- 55g sugar
- 11g salt
- 10g fresh yeast

Butter Block:
- 280g European butter (84% fat)
- 30g flour

Egg Wash:
- 1 egg + 1 tbsp milk

Instructions:
1. Mix dough ingredients; knead 5 minutes. Rest 30 mins.
2. Prepare butter block: Pound butter between parchment to 20cm square.
3. Encase butter in dough; perform 4 single folds (turn 90° each time), resting 1 hour between folds.
4. Final roll to 4mm thickness; cut triangles.
5. Proof 3 hours at 26°C with 70% humidity.
6. Bake at 200°C for 15 minutes; reduce to 180°C for 5 minutes.

Tips:
• Maintain 15°C room temperature
• Use ruler for precise measurements
• Chill between folds if butter softens
• Steam oven for better rise
• Freeze unbaked croissants for fresh baking anytime

title: Mexican Mole Poblano
content: The national dish of Mexico - complex, rich sauce blending chili peppers, chocolate, spices, and nuts. This Puebla-style version requires 30+ ingredients but delivers unforgettable depth of flavor.

Ingredients:
- 6 ancho chilies
- 4 pasilla chilies
- 2 mulato chilies
- 1/2 cup sesame seeds
- 1/2 cup almonds
- 1/4 cup pumpkin seeds
- 1 corn tortilla (charred)
- 1 plantain (fried)
- 1/2 cup raisins
- 1 onion (roasted)
- 4 garlic cloves
- 2 tomatoes
- 1/2 tsp cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp cloves
- 1/4 tsp anise
- 60g Mexican chocolate
- 3 cups chicken stock
- 1 tbsp sugar
- Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. Deseed and toast chilies; soak in hot water.
2. Separately toast nuts, seeds, and spices.
3. Blend all ingredients except chocolate into smooth paste.
4. Strain through fine mesh; simmer 2 hours.
5. Add chocolate; cook until thickened.
6. Serve over turkey or chicken with sesame garnish.

Tips:
• Toast ingredients individually
• Use metate for authentic texture
• Balance sweet/savory with sugar/salt
• Freezes well for 6 months
• Day-old mole tastes best

title: Italian Osso Buco
content: Milanese specialty featuring cross-cut veal shanks braised with vegetables, white wine, and broth until fork-tender, traditionally served with gremolata and saffron risotto.

Ingredients:
- 4 veal shanks (3cm thick)
- 1 cup flour for dredging
- 1/2 cup olive oil
- 1 onion (diced)
- 2 carrots (diced)
- 2 celery stalks
- 4 garlic cloves
- 1 cup dry white wine
- 2 cups veal stock
- 1 can San Marzano tomatoes
- 1 bouquet garni (rosemary, thyme, bay leaf)

Gremolata:
- 1/2 cup parsley
- 2 garlic cloves
- 1 lemon (zest)

Instructions:
1. Tie shanks with twine; dredge in flour.
2. Sear in oil until golden; set aside.
3. Soffritto: Cook onion, carrot, celery 10 mins.
4. Deglaze with wine; reduce by half.
5. Add tomatoes, stock, and bouquet garni.
6. Braise covered at 160°C for 2.5 hours.
7. Make gremolata by mincing ingredients.
8. Serve with risotto alla Milanese.

Tips:
• Ask butcher for 'milk-fed' veal
• Don't skip twine - keeps marrow intact
• Skim fat before serving
• Use marrow spoon for bones
• Leftovers make amazing pasta sauce

title: Indian Hyderabadi Biryani
content: The crown jewel of Nizami cuisine - layered aromatic rice and marinated meat cooked 'dum' style in sealed handi. This kacchi biryani version uses raw meat with parboiled rice for maximum flavor absorption.

Ingredients:
Marinade:
- 1.5 kg goat (bone-in)
- 2 cups yogurt
- 1/2 cup fried onions
- 2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
- 10 mint leaves
- 10 green chilies
- 1 tsp turmeric
- 2 tbsp lemon juice

Rice:
- 1 kg Basmati (soaked 30 mins)
- 4 bay leaves
- 8 green cardamoms
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 1 tsp caraway seeds

Assembly:
- 1/2 cup ghee
- 1 cup saffron milk
- 1/4 cup rose water
- 1/2 cup coriander leaves

Instructions:
1. Marinate meat for 4 hours minimum.
2. Parboil rice with whole spices until 70% cooked.
3. Layer handi: ghee → meat → rice → saffron milk → fried onions.
4. Seal with dough; cook on low heat for 90 minutes.
5. Rest 15 minutes before mixing gently.

Tips:
• Use aged Basmati (like Dehraduni)
• Maintain 1:1 rice-meat ratio
• Perfect seal prevents steam escape
• Serve with mirchi ka salan
• Leftovers taste better next day

title: Thai Som Tum
content: Isaan-style green papaya salad that balances spicy, sour, sweet, and umami flavors. Authentic version uses mortar and pestle to bruise ingredients for maximum flavor release.

Ingredients:
- 1 green papaya (shredded)
- 10 snake beans (cut)
- 5 cherry tomatoes
- 2 cloves garlic
- 5 bird's eye chilies
- 2 tbsp dried shrimp
- 1 tbsp palm sugar
- 3 tbsp fish sauce
- 2 tbsp lime juice
- 1 tbsp tamarind paste
- 2 tbsp roasted peanuts
- 1/4 cup long beans

Instructions:
1. Pound garlic and chilies in mortar.
2. Add long beans; bruise lightly.
3. Add palm sugar, fish sauce, lime juice, tamarind; mix.
4. Toss in papaya, tomatoes, dried shrimp.
5. Pound gently to combine flavors.
6. Garnish with crushed peanuts.

Tips:
• Use unripe papaya (firm texture)
• Adjust chilies to taste
• Add blue crab for authentic version
• Serve with sticky rice
• Eat immediately - gets watery

title: American Kansas City BBQ Ribs
content: Fall-off-the-bone pork ribs with signature sweet-spicy tomato-based sauce, smoked over hickory wood. Kansas City style emphasizes caramelized bark and finger-licking glaze.

Ingredients:
Rub:
- 1/4 cup paprika
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
- 1 tbsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp salt
- 1 tbsp chili powder
- 1 tsp cayenne

Ribs:
- 2 racks St. Louis cut ribs
- 1/2 cup apple juice (spritz)

Sauce:
- 2 cups ketchup
- 1/2 cup molasses
- 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
- 2 tbsp Worcestershire
- 1 tbsp mustard
- 1 tsp liquid smoke

Instructions:
1. Remove membrane from ribs; apply rub.
2. Smoke at 110°C (225°F) for 5 hours.
3. Spritz with apple juice hourly.
4. Wrap in foil with butter/honey; cook 1 hour.
5. Unwrap; glaze with sauce; cook 15 mins.

Tips:
• 3-2-1 method for perfect texture
• Maintain consistent smoker temp
• Use wood chunks (not chips)
• Rest 15 mins before slicing
• Sauce on side for competition style

title: Turkish İskender Kebab
content: Bursa's famous dish featuring thinly sliced döner meat over pide bread, smothered in tomato sauce and browned butter, served with yogurt and grilled peppers. Named after its 19th century inventor.

Ingredients:
- 500g lamb döner (vertical roast)
- 4 slices pide bread
- 2 cups tomato sauce
- 1/2 cup browned butter
- 1 cup strained yogurt
- 2 green peppers
- 1 tbsp sumac

Tomato Sauce:
- 4 tomatoes
- 1 tbsp pepper paste
- 1 tsp oregano
- 1 garlic clove

Instructions:
1. Grill döner slices on metal plate.
2. Toast pide; cut into squares.
3. Simmer tomatoes into thick sauce.
4. Arrange: pide → meat → tomato sauce → browned butter.
5. Serve with yogurt and charred peppers.

Tips:
• Slice meat paper-thin against grain
• Brown butter until nutty aroma
• Warm plates prevent cooling
• Authentic version uses lamb tail fat
• Pair with ayran drink

title: Spanish Paella Valenciana
content: The original paella from Valencia's countryside, featuring rabbit, chicken, and snails with bomba rice cooked in wide shallow pan. SOC (Socarrat) - crispy bottom layer is highly prized.

Ingredients:
- 400g bomba rice
- 1 chicken (cut)
- 1 rabbit (cut)
- 200g garrofó beans
- 100g tavella beans
- 1 tomato (grated)
- 1 tsp pimentón
- 10 snails (optional)
- 1.5 liters chicken stock
- 1 sprig rosemary
- Saffron threads

Alioli:
- 4 garlic cloves
- 1 cup olive oil
- 1 egg yolk

Instructions:
1. Sear meats in paella pan; set aside.
2. Sauté beans, tomato, pimentón.
3. Add rice; toast 2 minutes.
4. Pour hot stock; arrange meats.
5. Cook uncovered 20 minutes.
6. Add snails last 5 minutes.
7. Rest 5 mins before serving.

Tips:
• Never stir after adding stock
• Use orange wood fire for authenticity
• Test SOC by listening for crackles
• Serve with lemon wedges
• Leftovers make amazing arroz al horno
